SEQ0 - Q : Okay , Sonia , the first thing I want you to do is tell me your full name , and when and where you were born . And then just tell me a little bit about your growing - up years , your community .

SEQ1 - A : I was born in a small town POPULATED_PLACE there in Poland COUNTRY , this was a big town POPULATED_PLACE , Novogrudok POPULATED_PLACE . They had 10 or 15,000 people there . I was born in April 15 , 1922 , to a very rich father and mother . I had four brothers , two older and two younger than me . And I had my education there . I was studying in a liceum BUILDING , with languages . I finished gimnazjum , and then I went for two years in liceum BUILDING where I studied Latin , French , Polish , and History . When -- before the war broke out , I was two , three months before finishing my studies . I was dreaming to go to Paris POPULATED_PLACE , because we had a family there , to study dentistry in Sorbonne POPULATED_PLACE with the whole family . My mother ’s was there . But the war came in , and my dreams finished . The German came to the city POPULATED_PLACE in December 1941 . We did n't know nothing about the war . You know , it was small town POPULATED_PLACE . We know only that very bad will be for the Jewish people . But we could n't imagine it should be so , so bad , because when the first German came , they were dancing with us . And one -- I was a pretty girl , and one told my parents , “ Make her papers that she is Polish and let her go from the city POPULATED_PLACE , because it will be very bad . ” And that 's what -- when they went , they came , the S.D. and the S.S. , and the war began . In the beginning it was not so bad , because they begin -- After two months , they began to organize the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . So all the people went out from the houses BUILDING , and they put us on -- ina small -- in a couple of houses BUILDING . Pereseka BUILDING . They 're called , Pereseka BUILDING . This was like Brooklyn POPULATED_PLACE , New POPULATED_PLACE York , and Queens POPULATED_PLACE , like one of the city POPULATED_PLACE . And we were staying there till they said we have to go out in the streets DLF , and this began the Aktion . When the Aktion began , my father saw that is very bad , so he took me , and -- I had a brother -- Jay , and he said , “ Come on . I will show you something . ” And he ran away . He knew the policeman , the Polish , and they let us go . So I ran away to a village POPULATED_PLACE where my mother was born . And we stayed in a church BUILDING because my father know there the people . We stayed there about seven days under the church BUILDING . They had a place NPIP in Poland COUNTRY where the potato -- they were holding the potatoes should not freeze . And we staying there for a whole week . He let us stay . It was very nice . And after a week , he said , “ The action is gone and you can go to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . ” We did n't know where my mother was . But my mother was a very intelligent girl . She was a rabbi 's daughter . And she saw from far that my father went away with me , with my brother . She understood that he will take care , too , on us . So she took care on herself . She run to the village POPULATED_PLACE where she was born , this was Barabevit POPULATED_PLACE . And there friends of hers , what she was studying with them in school BUILDING , he keep her for 10 -- or two weeks .

SEQ2 - Q : Was he Jewish or not Jewish ?

SEQ3 - A : The friends ? Not Jewish , no . The people -- they were very good people , too , not Jewish . Not every Jew is good , too . There is certain people what are better than Jew . They were keeping us , and if they would find them , he would be killed together with his whole family . But he was keeping us . After two weeks , when I was already with my father and brother in the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE , he came in and he said , “ You know what , I would like to know if Mr. Boldo 1s alive . ” He did n't say that he has my mother . So they said “ yes . ” They let him in . And he said , “ You know , I have your wife . ” This was a shock for us because we were sure that she is not alive . And after a couple of days , she came and she was with us in the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE .

SEQ4 - Q : Will you tell me -- go back a little bit to the action and tell me what happened , and how your father got away . I mean , were you right there or did--

SEQ5 - A : We stayed near my father . My father was a tall , strong guy , and everybody knew him . So he sneaked in and he took me and my brother away from the line DLF . And you know this small houses BUILDING , so he keeps us in the house BUILDING for two hours or three hours till they took away everybody for killing . And we went out . The policemen saw him , but he did n't hold us . They let him go because he knew him from before . He was a Polish policeman . And that 's how we survive for the couple of months . After the action , we came back to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . We did n’t -- we were not hungry because the villages POPULATED_PLACE , the people , knew that we are there . They were bringing us food , bread , meat , everything . They were beautiful , wonderful people . And till today , we are sending them packages . They are not alive , but we send them packages to give to the kids .

SEQ6 - Q : Those -- the first actions , were they for specific people or -- I mean , in your town POPULATED_PLACE ?

SEQ7 - A : In our town POPULATED_PLACE , the first action was before the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . They took all the doctors , the intelligent people , and they killed them in the marketplace BUILDING — 50 of them . They took away the head of the city POPULATED_PLACE . And then in the month -- in December , this was a regular action for whoever was in the street DLF they took . This is the -- first of all , they took the men . They said that they are going to work on a -- work in a camp POPULATED_PLACE , a working POPULATED_PLACE camp . But they never came back . Nobody knew about it . But the paysans , that means people from the villages POPULATED_PLACE , they knew because they saw it . And they were coming to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE and they were saying , “ There is no camp POPULATED_PLACE . They are all killed . ” This was the first action .

SEQ8 - Q : That 's how your father knew what was happening ?

SEQ9 - A : Right . Right . He knew everything .

SEQ10 - Q : Okay . So you came back to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . And then tell me a little bit about living in the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE , and how long you were there , what it was like .

SEQ11 - A : We stayed in the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE , I think , a couple of months they came to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE -- after the couple of months , this was a regular living . You were working . I was working in the hospital BUILDING , and the others was working in the street DLF because the street DLF were bombardment , bombard . Everything was broken , so they were cleaning up . And this was not so bad . Nobody — they were thinking , you know -- people were thinking what ’s good is for me . They were thinking , “ I will survive . They are not touching us no more . ” And they were sitting . Then one day , a son of friends of ours came in . And said , “ You know what ? I saw 11 people from the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE that went out at night and I know where they went . They went to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , but nobody survived . Because they told them where to go , and the Germans were staying there already and waiting for them . ” And this was the first group for the trying to went out , and they were killed . So , you know , that ’s very difficult to go out . We can go out , but we will not be alive . So this was first time . This was -- I think this was already after the winter . The winter was very bad . In Poland COUNTRY , the winter is terrible . So this was probably in March or April another group went out , and we never heard about this . The German came and the they were gave -- they went to segregate the young and the healthy , and they took them to the court BUILDING there . In Novogrudok POPULATED_PLACE , there was a court BUILDING . And there in the court BUILDING they were working , and the rest stayed in the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE on the Pereseka BUILDING . There were the kids , the older , and the sick . They did n't kill all of them right away , but after a couple of months , yes . They begin to talking about in the court BUILDING that something 1s wrong . They ’re preparing something , the Germans . Nobody knew what and where . My parents stayed in there , in the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE , in Pereseka BUILDING . And my father said , “ I do n't want her to be there , ” to my mother . So they paid . We had money . We had gold . We had many things . And they paid to a Polish man what he was bringing the bread to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE , to the court BUILDING . So he paid him . And he bring in -- one night , he bring the bread to the court BUILDING , and he put me in the basket SPATIAL_OBJ from the bread . And he brought me to my parents . I was there not a long time , because my parents began to receive letters from the partisan , from my husband , from Alex . And he wrote him -- he did n't know me , I did n't know him . There is a big difference between from the village POPULATED_PLACE . He was from a village POPULATED_PLACE , very small , Stankiewicze POPULATED_PLACE . There were five houses BUILDING . One of the house BUILDING , one Jewish family , the Bielskis . And they had , I think , about 10 brothers and two sisters . And his sister was married to uncle of mine , but I never knew him , too . It was great uncle , whatever . And she said -- she was too , in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . And she said to him , “ You know what , I saw by the Boldos ’ a beautiful girl , and I would like you to send somebody after her . ’ And he was a very good- he had two -- he had a wife and a three - month - old child . But he did n’t go -- after she gave birth to the child , she did n't want to go to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . So this day when he send after her was the liquidation of this house BUILDING , and she got killed with the child . So he was by himself . And he wrote a letter to my parents that he will guarantee my safety . But I did n't want to go . I was afraid for the tree ENV_FEATURES FOREST . I was afraid for the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . I was afraid for everything because I never were there . But when my parents saw what is here , they said , “ Listen , I want you to go . I would like you -- better to die there than I would see you dead here . ” And he send a couple of men with rifles . And at night , my father paid again to the police , Polish . And I went out with the friend of mine , Leah , to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . I came there -- we went out there about 12 o'clock , we came there about four o'clock , to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST where we saw already about 18 people with rifles . I was afraid of them , too . I was not used to that , but I got used to that . And then I met my husband . So it was very nice in the morning , about 6 o'clock in the morning , my friends Chaya ’ that was already the girlfriends from mine other brother - in - law , Asael ’ . She said , “ You know , I have a commander and I am with him and I am very happy . ” I said to her — I was looking on her -- and I said , “ Can you tell me maybe there 's another commander ? ” She said , “ Yes . One is Alex , his brother , the younger . ” I said , “ “ Who is he ? Where is he ? ” She said , " Do n't worry . About seven o'clock you will see him . " And really about seven o'clock I saw a man with rifles , all over . I saw a man , a giant . He was six - two , and a young handsome -- I had afraid of him , too . But life is life . After -- He was very good to me from the beginning . He was very good to me . And he said to me , " You know , you came here . I would like you to stay with me . " I said , " You know what , I will stay with you , but I want you to take out my parents . " And I made with him like , “ You know , you have to take them out , then I will stay with you . ” And it took him all about seven or six days and my parents came . After my parents came , after a day , the whole ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE went in flames . But I came to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST end of August . August 15 was the second Aktion . And my brother died there , got killed . He did n't get killed in the action , but he saw that they were taking away my mother . My father was staying with me . So he went to work . My mother , so he wanted to take care on her . So he took her out from the lines DLF , dead , to the lines DLF of living . You understand what I am talking ? And the German -- the people were counted . And he knew that somebody is missing , but he could n't give out my mother . So they took him in on the truck SPATIAL_OBJ , but he was killed when he was running from the truck SPATIAL_OBJ .

SEQ12 - Q : They were doing a selection ?

SEQ13 - A : Selection , sure . Sure , a selection . This was August 15 , and in this selection my brother was -- got killed .

SEQ14 - Q : August 15 , * 42 ?

SEQ15 - A : Forty - two . In this selection , my brother was killed . That was my youngest brother and he was 17 , whatever . That 's it . Then my mother said , " You have to go . " When the bread came ' Leah Berkowski * Chaya Bielski * Asael Bielski in , he took me to my parents . This was after August 15 . He send -- my husband send a letter and I went away to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . That -- what I met him , in the morning , seven o'clock in the morning . And whatever he promise , he delivered . He delivered my parents . He took care very well on them . My mother was very fragile , but in the wintertime , she would n't stay in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . So he took all these men and they were putting her every day in another house BUILDING by the , by the villages POPULATED_PLACE . And she survived the winter . In the summertime she went to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST .

SEQ16 - Q : So , talk to me a little bit about ... Should we tell people to be quite ? [ Technical conversation |

SEQ17 - Q : Tell me -- You know , it 's unusual , this situation where a tremendous number of the people , the peasants and maybe even the people in the towns POPULATED_PLACE helped , but also there were collaborators . So tell me a little bit about how that worked ?

SEQ18 - A : The people from our city POPULATED_PLACE , they were very good to us . They knew us . And when the German came , my father and mother give away everything to the people . So they took care on us . And they were very nice , because their life was the same thing , in jeopardy like our life . And they did everything . And they were very good . I know after the war when I came to the city POPULATED_PLACE , to the house BUILDING . They recognize me right away , and they said “ Sonia , tell me what you need . ” And to my parents the same thing . They give the first food . They said , “ You can stay with us . ” They were very nice . They were people , beautiful . If not the people nobody survive , too . They gave us help . You can not tell that everybody was very bad , but there were people very good , too .

SEQ19 - Q : This situation where the actions happened , and they happened , small actions , but many , many . And the news spread of them , that 's somewhat unusual . There were a lot of areas REGION where people did n't know what was happening .

SEQ20 - A : No , nobody knew . In the morning , they came about six o'clock when the people are going to work and they right away they took them to the trucks SPATIAL_OBJ , so how did you know ? You did n't know nothing . When you knew , already it was too late .

SEQ21 - Q : When you got taken out of the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE and went to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , when was that ? Was that August or was that in the Spring ?

SEQ22 - A : This was end of August , beginning of September .

SEQ23 - Q : Okay . Do you know about a man named Anton Schmidt ?

SEQ24 - A : Schmidt ?

SEQ25 - Q : Yeah .

SEQ26 - A : No .

SEQ27 - Q : He was a rescuer who was executed in April . I was going to ask you about him .

SEQ28 - A : No , I do n't know .

SEQ29 - Q : Okay .

SEQ30 - A : I know about Kozlowski ’ . Kozlowski .

SEQ31 - Q : Tell me .

SEQ32 - A : Kozlowksi was a wonderful man . He born not far from my husband 's village POPULATED_PLACE . He were coming -- He went to the German , to the Polish , and he will bring all of the news to the brother Bielskis . They knew everything . If you need something , medicine or something , he went to the city POPULATED_PLACE and he bought it , or stole it , whatever . But the medicine we got . We got the salt and the sugar , whatever we needed from him . He was wonderful . Now the children become -- his children are alive and we are sending them money and packages and everything . He was one from the first . But he was bringing us everything . I know about him , because if somebody came from the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE -- people were coming from the ghettos GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE -- they did n't know where to go . So the first house BUILDING was Kozlowksi BUILDING 's house . So he was keeping them . And he said , " Do n't worry , somebody will come and they will take you to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . " They were beautiful people . You do n't have to forget this . You can not say that everybody was bad .

SEQ33 - Q : Tell me what it was like in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . Tell me about the setting up of the community , and tell me how it changed from that first --

SEQ34 - A : When I came into the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , they had only 75 people . That was the group of the Bielskis brothers . That was the four brothers -- the three brothers and they had their brother , Aaron , 13 years old . And they have a sister , what she was married to Chaya 's brother . So that was the Bielskis and the Dzienciolskis . This was the whole thing . But later came another seven men and they made 70 people , 70 or 80 people , when I came in . This was the beginning of the partisans because people were -- went away from the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST -- went away from the ghettos GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE . They did n't have a place NPIP there . And they -- the doors DLF from the Bielskis brother were open for everybody , for old , children , sick people . And they had always food . They did n't * Konstanty Kozlowski have steaks , but they have bread and water . They were very good . They were no different , but later , then many people came in . So there were men that said , “ Listen , why do I have to go and grab food and risk my life ? My wife is not here , my children are not here . Why should I risk the life for them ? ’ But the Bielskis brother said , “ Everybody who is coming has to have a place NPIP here . And eerybody will have a piece of bread . ” They will not have maybe something else , but bread they will give everybody . This was one kitchen INT_SPACE , one big kitchen INT_SPACE and they were cooking potatoes with a piece of bread . And this was the food . Later , when the people came in more and more , they went out and knew that the Germans were 1n this village POPULATED_PLACE . And the German came into the village POPULATED_PLACE and knew they will collect bread and butter and milk and meat , whatever . So we were putting ambushes -- ambush is that the right word ?

SEQ35 - Q : Uh - huh .

SEQ36 - A : ... and they were taking away the food from them . And that 's what we had the food for the partisans . We made ambush on them and got their rifles . We got everything from them . Nobody was sending us . They were killing the German . They took away the food , took away the rifles , and we were in business .

SEQ37 - Q : Do you know about -- I think it was probably soon after you came -- the big harvest , when the Germans were going to get a percentage of the harvest , and so they burned the -- tell me about that .

SEQ38 - A : The villages POPULATED_PLACE told us everything . Not us , to the Bielskis brother . They were afraid of them , terrible . One can not fight , but if you three brothers , six - two with rifles and you knew you can not live , you knew that he will touch something , whatever , you will not do the nght thing , they will be killed . So they did everything . They were telling us that in a couple of days they have to pay to the German so much and so much . Not in money , but in food . So the Bielskis knew that the food is coming . The villages POPULATED_PLACE are giving them . We need it , too , the food . So that 's what we took away . That was the harvest . That 's what you mean , right ? And we took away and we told to the villages POPULATED_PLACE , remember one thing , you giving them because you do n’t want , because Germans , too , they were killing them . They were killing them . They put everything on a fire and they went away . So you have to give them , half them and half to us . And that 's what they did . They were not always friendly , because you see , there were Aktions . The Bielskis were fighters . Not everybody , but they had a group of fighters . They had , the beginning , they had about 50 fighters . Later , the number went up and up and up . And they were not only fighting with the Polish police , they were fighting between the partisans , too . They were Polish -- not Polish , but German partisan — German -- Russian partisans . They were against us , too . First of all , because we were Jews . Second , because we knew better the neighborhood POPULATED_PLACE and we knew the people . So this was a plus , a big plus for us . And they were saying that we are taking away all of the food . Remember 1,000 people in the beginning . You have to feed them . And they were not sitting all of them in one place NPIP . We had afraid for that . So in groups , this was about 20 people in groups , they were sitting in the summertime up . In the wintertime , we had under the -- underground they were sitting . And when you are in the snow ENV_FEATURES , every little thing you can see . So we were very careful , but you know you can not take away from the villages POPULATED_PLACE . They knew very good . The Bielskis knew the place NPIP , but they knew , too . So we have to be in peace with them . You can not take away everything . You have to leave them , too , for the family , something . But we managed . We managed . In the wintertime , I never were in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . I was always -- it 's called a hutor DLF . This mean a farm DLF from one house BUILDING or two houses BUILDING . So I went with my husband and another 15 people . They were riders . And went there , sleep over about four or three hours and we went back to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . But they were very good to us . I can not say it . Nobody would survive if not the people from the villages POPULATED_PLACE . They had afraid , but they give us whatever we needed . Later , already in -- this was in ‘ 43 . In ‘ 44 , we got already the rifles and everything from Moscow POPULATED_PLACE . They were sending us by planes SPATIAL_OBJ . And they were bigger commanders than the Bielskis . They were commanders what they put on the front from the Russians , from Moscow POPULATED_PLACE . And they were good . They said to us like that . We were complaining always . You know , they have took a group of ours , 14 people . They took away their rifles , took away their food , and let them go without shoes even . They said , “ Remember Mr. Bielski -- brother Bielski , remember one thing , this 1s life . You have to fight for them -- for that . ” Not once my husband -- My husband was always between the German and the Polish army . The Polish , they were working together with the German , the Kozaks . He was always on the horses . He was giving everything to the all partisan and from the Naliboki puszcza ENV_FEATURES FOREST . You know what is a puszcza ENV_FEATURES FOREST , puszcza ENV_FEATURES FOREST is the biggest forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , you can not live there . This is only for the animals . This is not far from Novogrudok POPULATED_PLACE . This was between Novogrudok POPULATED_PLACE and Minsk POPULATED_PLACE . But we were there in the beginning . And they could n't find us because you have to go by foot or by horses . They were afraid . They can not go with the tanks SPATIAL_OBJ there . They were surrounding us and we heard them talking and shooting . And we were sitting on mud without food for 10 , for 12 days , till my husband -- I am telling you everything in one story -- till my husband said , “ They can not take no more hunger . ” This was the only brother he said , “ I can not -- I have to go fight myself . ” So he took 150 people -- not 150 , 90 people , and I was , too , in the group by my husband , and he opened the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . We come in after the German who saw the fire still burning . They were warming the food , but nobody touch it . When we went out to open the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , after a day , another 100 people went out and another hundred people because the Germans left us alone and we went away from there . And then we went to get organized again . This was the life . We were fighting them not in the open . You can not fight a German soldier in the open . We were surrounding them . We know where they are and we were fighting them and took off everything from them . And that ’s what this was life of the partisan . Not only us , there were the Russian partisan . The same thing , they were fighting , not in the open field DLF , because in the open field DLF you got killed from them . They had better everything .

SEQ39 - Q : So you hid in the woods ENV_FEATURES FOREST and waited till they came ?

SEQ40 - A : Yes .

SEQ41 - Q : And when you rode with your husband , that time when you first left the thick forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , were you carrying a gun , too ?

SEQ42 - A : Yeah , I had a gun . I had always a gun . But I never shoot the gun , no . When I was with my husband , I was not afraid of nothing , nothing at all . But when I did n't see him , I was afraid of everything . I had a gun for myself , for my protection . He gave it to me . Nothing else . This 1s it . I had a very good life in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . He gave to me everything . I never cooked . I never did nothing . I was the commander 's wife . You met my sister - in - law , Lilly . There were three brothers . The oldest was Tuvia . You know , in a small villages POPULATED_PLACE in small cities POPULATED_PLACE , the older brother is the head of the family . And when they got together , they put him , Asael , his older brother , and Zusia ’ , they made him a hero . They made him the head of the partisan . He was a very nice man . They , all of them , they were very nice .

SEQ43 - Q : If they had n't been there do you think that things would have worked out the way they did ?

SEQ44 - A : Never . Never . Nobody knew the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . They were born there . They were born in a small village POPULATED_PLACE , and they knew the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST and they knew the people . They knew everything . How could I survive , or somebody else ? All 1,200 people , nobody would survive . Because there were people from other city POPULATED_PLACE , too , not only from Novogrudok POPULATED_PLACE , from Lida POPULATED_PLACE , from Baranovichi POPULATED_PLACE , from Vilna POPULATED_PLACE -- the people never were in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . You know , Jewish people , they are not going to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . They are in the city POPULATED_PLACE . Only they survived because of the Bielskis brothers . I can not say because of Tuvia , because of Asael , because of Zusia . No , the three of them , they were one . Because nobody did something where the other one did n't want it . All of them , they work together . Whatever they had between them , nobody knew , but they were together . And that is what we survived .

SEQ45 - Q : How do you think they knew that the only way to survive was to go to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST ?

SEQ46 - A : Their instinct , instinct . You know , when you are born in a village POPULATED_PLACE , yes , you think that is the whole world NPIP . That is the whole world NPIP for them , for the people . They knew that if they would go to the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE they will get killed because once Tuvia got to the city POPULATED_PLACE to take something and they took him . The German took him , hit him so , so much . And he -- I do n't know how he survived . At night we were sitting , and he said , " What I am sitting ? What am I waiting for ? " And he ran away to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . The first in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST was my husband and his brother , Asael . How come the first ? My husband , when the German came , he was in the Russian army . They took him . You know , the Russian , when they came in ‘ 39 , they were taking the young > Aleksander Bielski people to the army for work , whatever . So he was in the army . But he saw on the road DLF going home BUILDING , he said that was terrible . Whoever came and they were asking him , “ Are you a Jew , or you are Polish ? ” whatever , they got killed . So he said “ no . ” He was speaking very nicely Russian and speaks beautiful Polish . And He does n't look like a Jew , he looks like a Russian . So he said that he will not get in the Russian -- in the German and that 's what he did . He came home BUILDING at night . He was in Bialystok POPULATED_PLACE in the army there . He came at night . He was swollen in the legs and everything . So his mother said to him , “ Stay for a couple of days home BUILDING . ” He said , " No , Mother . I am not staying . I will stay in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST near the house BUILDING . ” And that 's what happened , because in this time when she said to him , “ stay in the house BUILDING , ” and they came in the morning and took away his mother and his father and two brothers . And they never see the light of the day . And they were sitting not far away . And by now the girlfriends — he had a girlfriends , a Polish , and she made a place for him in the house BUILDING . So the first to went to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST was my husband and his brother , Asael . When they were already in forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , then came Tuvia . This was — did n’t take a long time , probably about a week or two . So and they had a sister in another village POPULATED_PLACE , Tajba . She was married to the Dzienciolski . When they heard about the German , the whole Dzienciolski family ran away and they left her with a small baby in the house BUILDING , the sister , Tajba . So my husband went and he took her out with the baby to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . She had the baby of nine months . She is still alive today . And they went in the morning to the people -- they did n't have children . And they said , “ Listen , at night ” -- This was wintertime already — “ at night I will bring my sister 's daughter , Lola . ° Please take care . If you will not take care and something happen to her , you will not be alive . ” And that 's what happened . He put -- my husband , he put the baby onto the door DLF . It was winter . And they were watching and they did n't hear nothing . They were sure that the baby is already in the house BUILDING . They forgot about it . So the baby was already frozen when they took her into the house BUILDING . And they took care on her . And they said , “ God sent us a baby daughter . ” And they took care till after she was three years . They did n't want to give her back after the war . No . But you know they took away and they appreciate very much , too . The daughter 1s alive . She is now 50 something . And last year , she was there and she saw not the family -- the family 's dead already -- but the children of the family . And this is -- she is alive today . That 's it .

SEQ47 - Q : Let 's talk about the community in the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST and when it got big , and the ziemlankas BUILDING ?

SEQ48 - A : Ziemlanka BUILDING ’ , ziemlanka BUILDING .

SEQ49 - Q : Tell me about building those for the winter . Tell me how they were made and how many there were and who stayed in them , and what they were used for . ° Lola Dzienciolski ’ Earthen hut ( Yiddish )

SEQ50 - A : I never stayed there . I went only to visit , because I had my parents there . This was for families , for sick folk , for children , for old . They had two fighters , because they went for food . And they stayed there the ziemlankas BUILDING — they called them ziemlankas BUILDING -- for the winter . It was like small rooms INT_SPACE . And many -- this was one row DLF with houses BUILDING , second row DLF , third one . They had a factory BUILDING . They made there — bakers they had -- they had bread they made . They made other foods . They made for the saddles for the horses . They made boots for people . And the Russian partisans , they were coming there . They were living there . They had a good dinner there , because you know , you had already everything . The people were giving you , because they had afraid of their lives . And they did n't give . So they send people out , and the people was bringing . They were not hungry . They had about 1,000 people . My husband was always in between the German and the Polish police . He never stayed there , he came only to visit them . So it was about 100 miles away from us . This was the big puszcza , Naliboki .

SEQ51 - Q : How long did that community exist ?

SEQ52 - A : This was staying till the end , till the end .

SEQ53 - Q : From — but when did it start ?

SEQ54 - A : It started after the Germans surrendered there . It was in ‘ 43 , I think , they surrendered there . And we were not still there , we were on in the raj on ’ . That mean between the houses BUILDING . Between the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , the small forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST , not big . And got killed , a couple , and I think five or six people got killed . And then we did n't have already a place NPIP there . It was too many . So we went to the Naliboki POPULATED_PLACE puszcza . And there we were settled and built the houses BUILDING and the ziemlankas BUILDING and the factories BUILDING and the bakeries BUILDING and everything . And the Ge-- and the Russian partisan came to us and they took , they took boots , they took for the horses , whatever they need to drive , too , saddles . And they were very happy with us . They had a good time with us there .

SEQ55 - Q : And you gave them --

SEQ56 - A : We gave them everything .

SEQ57 - Q : ... anything they wanted ?

SEQ58 - A : Everything you wanted . Everything , because they were higher than us . There in the puszcza POPULATED_PLACE , they had like people what they would send from Moscow POPULATED_PLACE . And this you had to give it to him .

SEQ59 - Q : But you were respected , the Bielskis ?

SEQ60 - A : Oh , they were respected all over . They were respect very much , because when they heard * area REGION ( Polish ) that the German are making , they wanted to surrender puszcza POPULATED_PLACE . They called right the Bielski brothers and they said , “ “ What to do , how can you help us ? ” They wanted to take away Asael and wanted to take away Zusia -- Alex , and Asael did n't want to go . And Zusia went because he saw that we have no other way . So he took 150 people , but they were only the fighters . And they put him in a new otriad . This mean a new partisan . They called Ordzonikidze . And he was bringing them to Platon . Platon was the head of all partisan . He was bringing all of the news , my husband was , like , you know , intell- -- like -- You know what I mean ?

SEQ61 - Q : Intelligence .

SEQ62 - A : Intelligence , right . He was the intelligence . And you were bringing him everything . And that is what we stayed -- not in the puszcza POPULATED_PLACE , he stayed always but five or four miles from the German , four or two miles from the police , the Polish . And were always fighting . Always .

SEQ63 - Q : Did you and your husband trust General Platon or --

SEQ64 - A : Not always . Not always . But remember , he was a very tough guy , my husband . He was -- till he went out , he would send the people to see if this is correct . But we did n't have too many things that they said to us that ’s true and was not true . Maybe a couple of times , but not too many . They had afraid of them . They had one partisan Victor Panchenko . He was a Russian commander . He began the partisan when the Russian people -- the soldier run away from the German , so he had the couple , and he began to be bigger and bigger and bigger . He was fighting us , too , in the beginning . Because he said , “ “ You taking away everything ; there is nothing for me . ” But they made it okay . If they will take about 50 -- sometimes Tuvia and Asael sent out about 15 , 20 people for bread . So the Russian partisan , they were taking away the bread . The were taiking aywat the bread and the salt . They were taking away the shoes and rifles . And we came in on that action where they took away everything . I came in with my husband . I was -- I did n't go always with him , but this time I went with him . And he saw that everything , the horses stays , he said , " Where are the people ? Where are Tuvia 's partisan ? ” He said , “ They are in the house BUILDING . They took away everything from them . Panchenko people took away everything from them . ” He went into the house BUILDING , and he said , “ Who gave it to you ? Who gave it to you the right to take away everything from them ? ” So they put the rifles to my husband . And he took right away the gun and said , " Come on . Come on , we will fight . " After 15 , 10 minutes , another Russian partisan came in and said , “ Okay . That is nothing . Come on . Take away everything . ” They give him away everything , because they had afraid .

SEQ65 - Q : How did they work that out ? How did it end up working out that --

SEQ66 - A : The Russian and the Jewish partisan ?

SEQ67 - Q : Yeah .

SEQ68 - A : They have places NPIP , and they said , “ Let 's divide this . The west NPIP is yours , the east NPIP is ours . ” And that 's what they are fighting . You can not go in all the places NPIP yourself because you have to give a chance to the other one , too . And then it was quiet . They were coming to the puszcza POPULATED_PLACE , and it was good . They were drinking vodka , they were eating . And everything was , again , in order .

SEQ69 - Q : Tell me about the friction with the other partisans because the Bielskis took in children , the old people , people who could n't carry guns . Tell me about that .

SEQ70 - A : I remember today there was a time that too many people came in . They were sick , and old , and children . So the other two brothers said , “ Listen , we are taking too many . What will be the end ? Now is summer , is not too bad , in the winter ” -- so Tuvia said like that , " I do n't care . I have to give place NPIP to everybody . ” The other partisans , they did n't want them , because when -- if somebody was going away from the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE and you were a Jew , sometimes they were killing them . They took away the boots . They were killing them . They took whatever they had .

SEQ71 - Q : You mean the partisans ?

SEQ72 - A : The partisans , yes . But once they took away and somebody told us , so they did the same thing to the Russian . And they stopped . They said , “ What are you doing ? What are you doing ? What for you need these people , they ca n't bring nothing . ” ’ But we did — the Bielskis did n't listen to them . They took in everybody . This was like the angels . Where would I go , and hundreds of me ? I did n't know where to go . I did n't know the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . I even did n't know how to take care of nothing . I was sitting maybe -- there were people were sitting under the tree ENV_FEATURES and waiting somebody should come to take them . Did n't know where to go . I have a partisan of ours , he is in London -- Cohen . ” He was with frozen legs . This was wintertime . And he was sitting three days with frozen legs under the tree ENV_FEATURES till he saw from far away horses . So he covered himself with the snow . He had afraid . He heard somebody talking something Commander Bielski . So he went out . My husband took him on his horse , and took him to the place NPIP where he was in the hospital BUILDING . And he is today without the fingers , but he 1s alive . And he 's in London . There another thing , we went to Israel COUNTRY a couple years ago , a couple -- about 10 , 15 years ago , and when we came , we have there two people what they were in the partisans , and they said to us like that , " You know what , one child wants to see you . " So my husband said , " How old is the child ? " " The child is about 35 years old . " He said , " Who is she ? " " You maybe do n't know , but you met her under the tree ENV_FEATURES with her mother . She was a baby , small baby . And she was sitting and crying . She did n't know what to do . " My husband said , " Do n't cry . You will be all right . ” And he went and put her under the horse , the mother and child and they still -- they are alive today with families . So you can not * Jack ( Idel ) Kagan remember everything what you did , but you did one thing , you gave them survivals . You gave them life . Then people were not so happy , too , in the partisan , because maybe somebody when he went to take the food , he had more food than somebody sitting the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . So -- but he had a piece of bread and the potato . The other one , maybe put a piece of butter or something else in pocket . He bring to his girlfriends , so maybe the other one was not happy . There were command , she -- partisans , but they were the head of 10 or 20 people . So they had better than somebody else , but that 's life . That 's life . There were many complaints , but this was nothing . Because the life for them , they were alive . They went to sleep , and did n't have afraid of the German for a long time . And this is what they did , the Bielskis . They will go into history like not many people , because Jewish partisan , Jewish were very little . There were Jews in other Russian partisan , but not like the Bielskis brother . They took anybody had the place NPIP , anybody had the place NPIP . And that 's what they did . The name -- I know my son . I have three sons . They are all born in Israel COUNTRY were . One is already a doctor , 45 . I have another son , he 1s 40 . And my baby -- no , the other one is 42 . This one is 41 . And this one , wherever he hears something , he is staying tall . He is six - two , too . “ That is my father . ” And the fighters , the same thing , like the father . My son the doctor , in ‘ 56 -- no , ‘ 73 , he went to Israel COUNTRY . He left his studies and he were fighting there on the Jordanian DLF border . My middle one is not so , but the baby , he finish college BUILDING , and he went and he was a parachute . You know what is parachute ? And he finished the parachute , they ask him to stay in the army . He say , “ No , I have to go home BUILDING , because I did n't say goodbye to my parents . ”

SEQ73 - Q : Okay . I will ask you something specific . You saved a person named Daniel Ostraszynsk1 .

SEQ74 - A : Yes , Ostraszansk1 .

SEQ75 - Q : Tell me about him .

SEQ76 - A : Daniel Ostraszanski was a friend of mine . We studied together in gimnazjum BUILDING and liceum BUILDING . And he was very intelligent guy . I took French , he took German . So when the German came , they ask , “ Who knows German ? ” So he said he . And he was 1n the J udenrat ' ” . So everybody , you know , you have a family , and you are expecting if you know somebody , he should take care on yourself . But he could n't . He even could n't take care of his mother and two sisters . He lost them , too . After the liquidation of the ghetto GHETTO POPULATED_PLACE , he came to the forest ENV_FEATURES FOREST . I , with my husband , went to sleep , to a village POPULATED_PLACE . And in the morning about seven o'clock , we came with the horses . My husband , he did n't go by himself , always with 10 people , riders . I see my friend is here . And they took off his boots and they put him on the tree ENV_FEATURES for shooting . I said , " Listen , Alex . That ’s my friends . " He said , " What do you mean your friends ? " I said , " I study with him . " And I told him the story , he could n't take care of his mother and sisters , too . So my father — my husband took him out from the tree ENV_FEATURES . He gave it to him the boots . And he said like that , “ “ Whatever he did , this will be after the war . Not now . You can not -- you can not kill him now , because we will hear his story . We heard your story , but he has something to say , too . ” ’ And this was -- they took him off of the tree ENV_FEATURES , and he 1s still alive in Israel COUNTRY . He is accountant , 20 people working for him . Whatever he did , I do n't know . I do n't know . My brother was , too , was in August 15 died . Maybe if I would see something , I would have said , “ You could save my brothers . ” But he could n't save . He could n't save his own family . How could he save somebody else ? But the people , you know , they looking for something . You know , when you losing a child , you losing a mother , you losing a brother , you want to say , “ that 's his fault , ” but that 1s not true . Not in my book . And he 1s still alive . And he is my best friends . He was my friends , and he is my friends .
